etymology.description: Depicts a bull's head with two horns and two ears
etymology.interpretation: The character 牛 distinctly represents the head of an ox, featuring its prominent horns and ears. This straightforward pictorial representation captures the essence of an ox, reflecting on its physical characteristics recognizable in ancient agrarian societies.

examples.chinese: 农场里有一头牜(農場裡有一頭牛)，它勤劳地工作(它勤勞地工作)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngchǎng lǐ yǒuyī tóu niú, tā qínláo de gōngzuò.
examples.english: There is an ox on the farm, and it works hard.

examples.chinese: 牜在田野上拉犁耕地(牛在田野上拉犁耕地)。
examples.pinyin: Niú zài tiányě shàng lā lí gēngdì.
examples.english: The ox pulls a plow in the fields.
